template.name: CoroSync-Ring-0
template.description:
## Overview Template and script below checks the status of the corosync Ring(s) 1: Create a Script File under the zabbix scripts directory, called corosync.pl and paste the script content into it 2: Make it executable and ownd by the zabbix user 3: Add the user Parameter below to the zabbix agent on the cluster nodes **Zabbix Agent Config:** ``` **#** # Corosync Status # UserParameter=check\_corosync[*], /etc/zabbix/scripts/corosync.pl $1 ``` **Corosync Script:** #!/usr/bin/perl my $sudo = '/usr/bin/sudo'; my $cfgtool = '/usr/sbin/corosync-cfgtool -s'; $num\_args = $#ARGV + 1; if ($num\_args != 1) { print "
Usage: corosync.pl ring number
"; exit; } my $ringNumber = $ARGV[0]; open( $fh, "$cfgtool |" ) or die ( "Running corosync-cfgtool failed" ); foreach my $line (<$fh>) { if ( $line =~ m/status\s*=\s*(\S.+)/ ) { my $status = $1; if ( $status =~ m/^ring $ringNumber/ ) { # print "RING NUMBER $ringNumber STATUS: $status
"; if ( $status =~ m/^ring $ringNumber active with no faults/ ) { print "0"; } else { print "1"; } exit; } } } close($fh) or die ( "Running corosync-cfgtool failed" ); ## Author Roland KÃ¤ser
